dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2791 IS: Supporting Early-childhood Educators’ Deductions Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Bennet (for himself and Ms. Collins) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow early childhood educators to take the educator expense deduction, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting Early-childhood Educators’ Deductions Act or the SEED Act.

section.header: Educator expense deduction to include early childhood educators

subsection.text: Section 62 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(2)(D), by striking elementary and secondary in the heading and inserting early childhood, elementary, and secondary;
in subsection (d)(1)(A), by striking kindergarten through grade 12 teacher and inserting, early childhood or kindergarten through grade 12 teacher, educator; and
in subsection (d)(1)(B), by striking elementary education or secondary education and inserting early childhood education (through pre-kindergarten) or elementary or secondary education.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to expenses incurred in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
